text: Anvar Abdulakhadovich Zakhidov (; born 2 May 1953) is an Uzbek-American physicist from the University of Texas at Dallas. Born in Tashkent, he worked on superconductors in Japan for five years before immigrating to the United States in 1997, where he joined Honeywell in the private sector. He was awarded the status of Fellow in the American Physical Society after he was nominated by the Division of Materials Physics in 2009. He was installed for his pioneering contributions to the design, fabrication, characterization, and understanding of advanced functional nanomaterials and associated devices, including carbon nanotubes; superconducting and magnetic fullerenes; photonic crystals; solar cells; OLEDs; and cold field emission cathodes. == References == Category:Living people Category:1953 births Category:People from Tashkent Category:Uzbek physicists Category:American physicists Category:Uzbekistani emigrants to the United States Category:Fellows of the American Physical Society Category:American Physical Society Category:University of Texas at Dallas faculty
title: Anvar Zakhidov
